Working class kids have an adverse childhood experience which are rarely noticed by the people, the percentage of low income kids is quiet high comparative to upper-income kids as per the study by the Wisconsin Children's Trust Fund. Childhood is basically when child notices somebody getting hit or yelled, speaker’s mother was exposed to childhood trauma when she found her father drunk and mom shouting at him, this type of incidences have a negative impact of child’s mind. As per Wisconsin Children's Trust Fund, children are exposed to number of such incidences which are related to abuses or drug addiction which leaves them isolated in the society. Working class kids have an adverse childhood experience because their parents either keep on yelling on each other or hit each other, even the drug addiction among them leaves kids isolated which further leads to childhood trauma.

Infectious diseases a main cause of human suffering, whether human have drugs and vaccines to overcome from such diseases but still there is a need to discover new drugs as lot of old drugs are losing their efficacy, like human, animals also use medication and we need to learn from them how to treat our diseases. Interesting recent discoveries are telling us that insects and other little animals with smaller brains can use medication as we do, we all know that a lot of the drugs that we have developed are losing their efficacy. And therefore, there is this great need to find new ways to discover drugs and treatment. Animals are so much different from us and they use plants to treat their intestinal parasites and we human need to learn this creative from them has our developed drugs are not that effective as thought to be. Humans are creative and have found the ways to protect themselves from the infectious diseases and are over coming from various diseases which lost their efficacy before and human has learn this technique from the animals like chimpanzee, elephants etc.

There's about 113 million books that have been written since the dusk of time. Companies like Google have digitized many of them -- above 20 million approximately. And when the stuff of history is available in digital form, it makes it possible for a mathematical analysis to very quickly and very convincingly review trends in our history and our culture. So I think in the next decade, the sciences and the humanity will come closer together to be able to answer deep questions about mankind. And I think that mathematics will be a very powerful language to do that. It will be able to realize new trends in our history, sometimes to explain them, and maybe even in the future to predict what's going to happen.

640048e8923944e2b10773b65d56810a 7fdd81499d6147a1b4a817e56db88024 LISTEN_AND_HIGHLIGHT LISTENING You will hear a recording. Below is a transcription of the recording. Some words in the transcription differ from what the speaker(s) said. Please click on words that are different. 00:00:00 00:00:00
Dane is a serious entrepreneur who started many companies in a pay secrecy condition and even used that condition to pay three equally qualified people dramatically different salaries, depending on how well they could negotiate. And Dane saw the strive that happened as a result of this. So when he started his newest company, Sum All, he committed to salary transparent from the beginning. And the results have been amazing. And in study after study, when people know how they're being paid and how that pay compares to their peers', they're more likely to work hard to improve their performance, more likely to be engaged, and they're less likely to quit. That's why Dane's not alone. From technology start-ups like Buffer, to the hundreds of thousands of employees at Whole Foods, where not only is your salary available for everyone to see, but the performance data for the store and for your department is available on the company intranet for all to see.
Listening - Highlight Incorrect Words- Q13 Listening - Highlight Incorrect Words- Q131.tpm 8 100

So what I did during my job is cultivate plants in the greenhouse, different ones, diverse milkweeds. Some were toxic, including the tropical milkweed, with very high concentrations of these cardenolides. And some were not toxic. And then I feed them to monarchs. Some of the monarchs were healthy. They had no disease. But some of the monarchs were sick, and what I found is that some of these milkweeds are medicinal, meaning they decrease the disease symptoms in the monarch butterflies, meaning these monarchs can live longer when they are infected when feeding on these medicinal plants.
